intro: Pergularia angustiloba, commonly known as narrow-leaved pogostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, clustered in whorls along the stem, and it produces small, four-lobed fruits. Pergularia angustiloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
